N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 85.8 - Premises

State Regulations
(a) The certificate
holder shall maintain premises appropriate and adequate for the safe and
effective examination, diagnosis, care, treatment, and rehabilitation or
training of all persons served. (b) The space provided shall be both adequate and appropriate for: (1)

The maintenance of privacy for interviews
between staff members and the persons served, (2)

The comfort and convenience of those
waiting for services, (3)

Accommodation of activities and equipment necessary to special activities such
as group discussions, play therapy, medical examinations, occupational therapy, speech and hearing therapies, or others which are regularly provided, and
(4)

Controlled access to and
maintenance of case records. (c) If medications are stored or dispensed on
the premises of the facility, the certificate holder shall provide for
controlled access and maintenance of supplies in accordance with all applicable

Federal, State, and local laws and regulations. (d) The premises, whether stationary or
portable, shall comply with all local zoning and building laws, regulations and
ordinances. (1)

Heating, lighting and
ventilation shall be adequate for the comfort and well-being of the persons
served and the employees. (2)
A
written certificate of occupancy by the local building inspection authority
shall be retained in the records of the facility. (e) The premises shall comply with all local
fire safety, sanitation and health laws, regulations and ordinances. Written
certification of approval by all authorized local authorities shall be retained
in the records of the facility. (f) Mobile premises and their use shall comply with all applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. Notes
